Comments_List: I developed a greater understanding of how progressions work by learning about chromaticism.
A basic understanding of sight singing and transcription.
I think this course is very well taught.

Yes, especially if you are looking to fulfill the lessons for credit requirement. Although finding the motivation to get out bed and sing whole tone scales at 9:30 in the morning can be difficult, the classroom environment is laid-back and friendly and you'll learn and develop some useful skills along the way. The required weekly keyboard labs can be fun if you go in with a good partner, especially since you'll be able to decide what kind of material/skills you want to work on for the semester.
Yes, it provides a fairly useful base on which to build.
